Class ServerBaseImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.jndn.utils.server.ServerBaseImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Server, Runnable, net.named_data.jndn.OnInterest
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SegmentedServer, SimpleServer

    public abstract class ServerBaseImpl
extends Object
implements Server
    Base implementation for a Server.
    Author:
    Andrew Brown

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerBaseImpl

        public ServerBaseImpl(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
              net.named_data.jndn.Name prefix)
        Build the base server; register() must run separately and is run automatically on run().
        Parameters:
        face - a Face allowing prefix registration (see Face.setCommandSigningInfo(net.named_data.jndn.security.KeyChain, net.named_data.jndn.Name)
        prefix - the Name to register

    • Method Detail

      • getPrefix

        public net.named_data.jndn.Name getPrefix()
        Specified by:
        getPrefix in interface Server
        Returns:
        the Name prefix this server is serving on.

      • getRegisteredPrefixId

        public long getRegisteredPrefixId()
        Specified by:
        getRegisteredPrefixId in interface Server
        Returns:
        the registered prefix ID of the server on the Face or -1 if unregistered

      • isRegistered

        public boolean isRegistered()
        Returns:
        true if the server has registered a prefix on the face

      • register

        public void register()
              throws IOException
        Register a prefix for responding to interests.
        Throws:
        IOException - if IO fails

      • addPipelineStage

        public void addPipelineStage(PipelineStage<net.named_data.jndn.Data,net.named_data.jndn.Data> pipelineStage)
        Add a stage to the server pipeline. Each stage should be processed once the server has the Data packet available to send (e.g. after a callback has produced a packet); also, stages should be processed in the order they are added.
        Specified by:
        addPipelineStage in interface Server
        Parameters:
        pipelineStage - a Data-to-Data processing stage

      • processPipeline

        public net.named_data.jndn.Data processPipeline(net.named_data.jndn.Data data)
                                         throws Exception
        Process the Data before sending it; this runs the packet through each registered PipelineStage in order.
        Parameters:
        data - the Data to process
        Returns:
        a processed Data packet; no guarantee as to whether it is the same instance as passed in as a parameter (and likely not).
        Throws:
        Exception - if a pipeline stage fails

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
